fields.headline: No silliness
fields.bodyText: Max Hastings wrote in his article on pensions that I had suggested that graduates should keep working until they are 70 to make up for their special advantages in life (Comment, June 13). He described this as "silly". This is exactly the word that the pensions commission has used to describe the idea as well. We need an intelligent debate on pensions. A useful contribution would be if journalists of the quality of Max Hastings worked on the assumption that reports of obviously silly ideas are likely to be misleading. Adair Turner Pensions commission
